embeds.title: Bottled Anomaly
embeds.description:
Shop Relic / All / Downfall

Upon pickup, choose a card. At the start of each combat, remove it from your draw pile. At the start of turn 3, add it into your hand. It costs 0.
*Swirling and swirling and finally breaking.*

messages.content: with 2 copies of Combo+
It was a fun time until I died to Donu Deca
Bottled anomaly is quite possibly my favorite relic in downfall fun-wise
It's just so much energy save
Works best on guardian and silent probably
<combo>

embeds.title: Combo
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Put the first  (2) **Dead On** card (cards) triggered each turn back into your hand.

messages.content: I've been really getting into hermit recently
Funny, I was one of the big hermit haters like a year ago
Can you play It for 0 cost multiple times?
Yeah you can usually play it twice. The first time at 0 cost from lone wolf, and combo puts it right back in your hand to play it a second time.
Does the 2nd play also cost 0?

I have a bit of a soft spot for this card. I’m still not sure how genuinely good it is, and I rarely buy It from shops or take it over other rares from boss rewards. However, I have transformed into it, and gotten it from building up rare chance, and been surprisingly happy with it. It is probably one of the most important cards to land dead-on with, and really wants to be played alongside cheap concentrate, draw, and discard effects. Having the 4th energy is also really helpful for it, since you can move your hand around more freely and still cast it, as well as play tracking shot before it. Snecko eye is a bit if a double-edged sword, it will be cheaper to play, but actually getting the dead-on will likely be harder. It benefits significantly from eternal form, which can make playing the rest of your hand very easy, and lowers the cost down to 2, so you will get the benefit much more often. 

Other energy manipulation methods like eye of the storm or ice cream can also help you get the full benefit more often, and you can combine it with lone wolf to both assure the bonus and make it more castable. I’ve been surprised by just how many ways there are to support this, and I do think the odds are reasonably high of finding one even if you take this completely blindly, though I still don’t think the payoff is strong enough to recommend that. The other element is that sometimes you just get lucky, and it ends up doing seriously efficient work and giving you a great turn, especially if you are playing a decent number of 0 cost cards in your deck, or cleverly using things like attack potion or swift potion to reposition your hand. It also happens to just be very solid in act 1 alongside your memento, ending most fights in very short order, making it irrelevant whether or not you got the bonus block.

It’s really good into all 3 act 1 elites if you get it from neow or an early transform, and can really help get a snowball rolling if you use the block to completely shut out gremlin nob or lagavulins damage, and the damage is still high enough to be very relevant even if you don’t.

The major drawback is the inconsistency of that bonus block, as well as how poor this sort of card is in acts 3 and 4, as it only (reliably) deals damage, and requires sinking a lot of energy into it. I wish I could tell you how good this card is, but it’s really variable based on how well you can manipulate your hand, and during what part of the run you see it. The upgrade sort of doubles down on the variance, both numbers go up significantly, but it is a 3-cost card, so that makes sense. I wouldn’t upgrade this unless you were very confident about your ability to land the dead-on component, though it is very impressive if you can. Can also be very cool with Necronomicon and the right support. Note that if you use bottled anomaly, it will be added to the far right of your hand, after you've drawn, making it very difficult to land the dead-on that turn.
I'd assume not hence the play it twice instead of 3 times
no, but with either 4 energy or lone wolf+ you will have enough energy to play it a second time

I already said this the last time we discussed dead on, but I don't really like this card on the basis that it doesn't just naturally combo with the rest of the dead on cards the way they do with each other, nor with the extra card draw associated with the dead on package.
I'd maybe take it if the other card choices were garbage, but without lone wolf you just don't have enough energy to reliably get the bonus
I think it's fine to have a card as a rare that is harder to work around, but if you do it is really good.
And this is 54 block/damage for 3 cost, so 18 block/damage per energy. It is awkward to get off and probably needs some support, but hermit has cheat, lone wolf, and eye of the storm.
I just feel like if it cost 2 and you decreased all the numbers by 30% I would find it a lot more tempting
Idk I think it's fine where it is, where it's not always a fantastic option, but when you get it early and can afford to build into it, it goes hard
These are often weaker cards, but are some of the more fun designs
well in this case "I don't like" means "I won't usually take it", not "I think it's badly designed"
I agree, I usually don't take it, but not every card should be "usually taken"

I think commons should have a more universally useful role, uncommons being a bit stronger and still generally applicable, but a tiny bit more specialized, and rares should be very specialized. At least in my ideal world.
this card was way better before <snipe> got nerfed

embeds.title: Snipe
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.)
Your next **Dead On** effect this turn triggers twice.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: its like alright now, its very similar to sunder in your early game but can give block later on if you can play the card dead on; which usually means having an extra energy to do so reliably as the card costs 3

it was previously super strong with snipe since you could block for 40 with just 3 energy, but now that snipe exhausts you need other forms of block to sustain yourself in boss fights; which is problematic since decks that primary focus on dead on tend to struggle a lot with blocking.
What was old snipe again?
Oh interesting
Yeah definitely think that was a little strong
I'd rather the upgrade lose exhaust than concentrate

snipe is still a pretty good card on its own merits; but it exhausting really hurts rough house in particular since its the only super high value dead on effect you want to have doubled (besides snap shot)

like for the other dead on cards you can live with only having one use of something like snipe + headshot because that headshot is probably just killing the enemy the first time and you can scale up for bigger fights.
acutally wait <deadeye> also hates snipe nerf. Although its still a nerf thats felt much more by roughhouse then any other card

messages.content: I love take aim tbh
Makes me have to think less, works well with roughhouse, with fatal desire you usually can play every dead on that you realistically want to
ya when you have fatal desire is when you want take aim at all since the curses will stop you from using dead on
I find that hermit tends to over rely on powers past the mid game a lot though so theres rarely room for take aim in my decks as i'm already scared of awakened one
I've found that with maintenance and dive/scavenge, woke bloke is honestly the easiest of the 3 fights

Most of the time I fight it I have a few copies of dive (it is my go-to defensive card, I love it) I stall the first phase until like 40 plated armor. I won't play my fatal desire until the turn I end phase 1.

Deal 50 (60) damage to ALL enemies.

messages.content: Cause it takes a lot to actually play this card consistently
I've never gotten grand finale to work
One time I'm just gonna cheat it in as a Neow bonus probably
Usually it can be achieved with a couple of removes into double acrobatics/tactician
Piramid obviously makes the process much easier but you can easily do it with silents innate draw
The main issue with that kinda of deck is blocking though
I find this claim weird because I think hermit's best non-exhausting block cards are the dead on ones.
The Dead On block cards are very good at front loaded block but can struggle against the act 3 and 4 fights in my experience
They need to get a little creative to block late game
pretty clearly a good card to take act 1 but it quickly gets in the way if you rely on luck of the draw and don't consistently cheat the energy with cheat or lone wolf
I like how if you draw it dead on u can just dump your entire turn into 1 card and it'll be better than most things you can do with your turn early game
I really like grand finale, its a real damage solution for me
though its definitely unpickable quite a bit
obviously the things that turn it on are well laid plans and a high density of draw cards
i agree dead on block cards a really good but fall off a bit vs the heart, all block cards fall off vs the heart short of invincibility mechanics or powers >u<
though the weakening dead on card is good if u don't draw it with a bunch of status cards
Question: would you consider roughhouse a defensive dead on card??
yes but there are much better block cards that don't deal 30
i take it more to deal 45 in act 1 - 2 and the 24 block just makes it more playable
